About

AisenLink

All about Tinkering and Hacking for The Connected Things

Guess what, you've come this far because you love to tinker and to hack things. Tinkering is a unique way to understand how things work, and hacking is an effort to add or improve features beyond its current state. Things can be anything from everyday objects to sophisticated computer technologies around us. Nowadays, more and more machines can communicate to each other without human intervention. When things get connected, they are able to exchange information. They become smarter devices and aware of its surrounding. People call this intelligent as the Internet of Things (IoT). I simply call it - The Connected Things.

This website is hosted on Github Pages. The template was taken from Jekyll-Pure project by Xiongzhi Gao, with a lot of improvement here and there. The posting tag's CSS was taken from Twitter Bootstrap and those attractive icons were taken from Font Awesome. The cartoon owl was designed by lemmling and bocian, freely available to download from OpenClipart. For comments posting, Disqus seems great, but I don't have it set just yet. So, if you have something to say, please feel free to email me or use Skype. I appreciate any comments or ideas to improve this website. Better yet, if you find this place useful, please consider donating any amount in USD/Euro by clicking the Paypal button below. Thank you.
